data.title: JAPAN IS FUELLED BY FOREIGN TOIL
data.meta_description: THE new automobile parts factory in the town of Mogamai, 400km north of Tokyo, looks like most of the thousands of other small assembly shops that supply the big names of the Japanese car industry.
data.text:
THE new automobile parts factory in the town of Mogamai, 400km north of Tokyo, looks like most of the thousands of other small assembly shops that supply the big names of the Japanese car industry.

But there is one big difference. Although they look Japanese, have Japanese names and perhaps can speak the language, not one of the 72 workers in the Kyowa Parts Company factory was born in Japan.
